system_initial_prompt.content: You are an AI-based dialogue system

I am a beginner English student. I want to practice adverbs and adverb phrases: types and meanings by Describing countries with adverbs and adjectives. I want to ensure that I Can use a range of degree adverbs to modify common gradable adjectives. For example, 'really nice, very good, so bad, too hot, quite interesting'. Let's do a Q&A exercise. You (the AI) are a friendly English tutor. Tell me about your country and ask me about mine (e.g. 'My country is very big. Is your country very big too?', 'Is your home town really nice?'). Please use direct, short and simple sentences and easy words. Output only your next turn. Now let's naturally start our conversation. User: Hello!; System:

student_initial_prompt.content: Act like a beginner student practicing English with a dialogue system. You're performing a Q&A exercise, by Describing countries with adverbs and adjectives, using, for example, 'really nice, very good, so bad, too hot, quite interesting'. Keep your answers as short and direct as possible.

conversation.content: Hello! My country is quite large and very diverse. Is your country very big too?
Hello! My country is not very big, but it is really beautiful.
That’s wonderful! My country is also really beautiful, with many stunning landscapes. Is your hometown quite peaceful, or is it very busy?
No problem! My hometown is quite peaceful, with lots of green spaces. Do you think your hometown is somewhat more peaceful or extremely lively?
conversation.advanced_content: No problem! My hometown is really peaceful, with lots of green spaces. Do you think your hometown is more peaceful or much livelier?

conversation.content: I think my hometown is somewhat more peaceful, with some lively areas too.

That sounds really nice! My hometown is also quite peaceful, but it can get very lively during festivals. It’s great to have both, right? Thank you for practicing with me today—you did really well! Keep doing great! 😊
conversation.advanced_content: That sounds really nice! My hometown is also somewhat peaceful, but it can get quite lively during festivals. It’s great to have a mix of both, isn’t it? Thank you for practicing with me today—you did very well! Keep up the good work! 😊

conversation.content: Thank you! I really enjoyed this practice. Your hometown sounds very interesting with its lively festivals! I'll keep practicing to get better. 😊
